intro: Echites nutans, commonly known as the drooping spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a rough texture. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in cyathia, typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Echites nutans is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of light conditions.
